data.title: Paul Scofield to Appear In London 'Rappaport'
data.text:
Paul Scofield has been signed for the London production of ''I'm Not Rappaport,'' which will open July 14 at the Apollo Theater.

He will play the role of Nat, created by Judd Hirsch.

The play, which celebrated its 300th performance here last weekend, is expected to show a profit before London rehearsals begin on April 28.

Producers for the British production, which will play in Birmingham and then in Manchester or Bath before moving to the West End, are Theater Projects Associates and Robert Fox with James Walsh, Lewis Allen and Martin Heinfling.
